data.title: Shakespeare in the Park
data.statement:
The bard has hidden his message in an NxN field of characters.  The first character of the message is at position (x,y), where (0,0) is the upper left corner.  If the 3-digit ASCII code of the character is ABC, then the next character is at (x+AB,y+C) modulo N (e.g the ASCII code for 'x' is 120, so AB=12 and C=0).

If the ASCII code is 2 digits, then A=0 (e.g the ASCII code for 'X' is 88 so AB=8 and C=8).

data.stubGenerator:
read x:int
read y:int
read N:int
loop N read line:string(256)
write message
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The starting  [[x]] position.
<<Line 2:>> The starting  [[y]] position.
<<Line 3:>> The size [[N]] of the field.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> The field values.
data.outputDescription: One line with the bard's message. The message ends with either a period (.) or a question (?) mark.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The bard has hidden his message in an NxN field of characters. The first character of the message is at position (x,y), where (0,0) is the upper left corner. If the 3-digit ASCII code of the character is ABC, then the next character is at (x+AB,y+C) modulo N (e.g the ASCII code for 'x' is 120, so AB=12 and C=0).

If the ASCII code is 2 digits, then A=0 (e.g the ASCII code for 'X' is 88 so AB=8 and C=8).
Input
Line 1: The starting x position.
Line 2: The starting y position.
Line 3: The size N of the field.
Next N lines: The field values.
Output
One line with the bard's message. The message ends with either a period (.) or a question (?) mark.
Constraints
10 ≤ N ≤ 40
Example
Input
10
11
19
x XI E`fF^Vtfxx<!^w
ts4Nm8o;-]6bOk#1gF>
I5+` HMn634*I6onG`o
hIphV7n3FhtQ]>p?;.+
;[B%^M#ZbRe\HDfeZ2;
rs2 Sp*l7^aRKUZ*_eA
(=UhWO*Jpph6V@cC?cl
oqled4i^_,Qhl)IL$ng
[-ye`i+ltqr-1,&^)?&
ie XDlo3JuOX3R:'"O3
# m)P_J,#:/:teoZ1/v
XTam t;\A,T3f,[qU4;
9iZW1[LrLw=v>2.(s t
OMXKTdTqNRT,G/Mc;eL
aoWpWx%FC5V2:;,y&1J
pe@g9"rS4=%ZrH3;h?o
>VlCi'&Jm0 =\A`\rvu
VT)0R3Z7 O^ygjj[oK1
e-:1-Fpa 5@t=buM E0
Output
To be, or not to be: that is the question.
